DataElement.preferredName: Disease or Disorder Sickle Cell Disease Status Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A description of the disease status of sickle cell disease.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function._A condition or state at a particular time.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A definite pathologic process with a characteristic set of signs and symptoms. It may affect the whole body or any of its parts, and its etiology, pathology, and prognosis may be known or unknown.

Concepts.definition: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.

Property.preferredDefinition: A condition or state at a particular time.

Concepts.definition: A condition or state at a particular time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A blood disorder characterized by the appearance of sickle-shaped red blood cells and anemia._A condition or state at a particular time._Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Disease recurred: on disease modifying therapy
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Upon Disease or Disorder Change Therapeutic Procedure Recurrent Disease

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Upon Disease or Disorder Change Therapeutic Procedure Recurrent Disease
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.: The return of a disease after a period of remission.

Concepts.definition: Used to indicate that an event is to immediately follow another event.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
The act of alteration or modification; changed or altered in form or character.
An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.
The return of a disease after a period of remission.

PermissibleValues.value: Disease recurred: Hb S > 50% and clinical symptoms described are present

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Hemoglobin Electrophoresis Less Than or Equal To 50 Percentage And Absence of Signs or Symptoms Disease or Disorder Cure
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.: An electrochemical process in which macromolecules or colloidal particles with a net electric charge migrate in a solution under the influence of an electric current.: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::50: A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.: An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.: Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.: Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.: Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.

Concepts.definition: The red respiratory protein of erythrocytes, consisting of approximately 3.8% heme and 96.2% globin (64.5 KD), which as oxyhemoglobin (HbO2) transports oxygen from the lungs to the tissues where the oxygen is readily released and HbO2 becomes Hb.
The motion of charged particles in a colloid under the influence of an electric field; particles with a positive charge go to the cathode and negative to the anode.

A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest is smaller than the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.
A fraction or ratio with 100 understood as the denominator.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.
Absence of detectable signs or symptoms.

Any abnormal condition of the body or mind that causes discomfort, dysfunction, or distress to the person affected or those in contact with the person. The term is often used broadly to include injuries, disabilities, syndromes, symptoms, deviant behaviors, and atypical variations of structure and function.
Serving or tending to restore health; a remedy.
